com.compendium.core.db
Class DBMovies

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.DBMovies

public class DBMovies
extends java.lang.Object

The DBMovies class serves as the interface layer between the Movie objects and the Movies table in the database.

Author:
Michelle Bachler

Method Detail

insert

public static Movie insert(DBConnection dbcon,
                           java.lang.String sMovieID,
                           java.lang.String sViewID,
                           java.lang.String sLink,
                           java.lang.String sName,
                           long startTime,
                           java.util.Vector<MovieProperties> props)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
Inserts a new movie record in the database and returns a Movie object representing this record. NOTE: If the record already exists, it returns the existing record. If an import is being run and updating was set or if it is not an import, then the record is first updated with the passed data. But it is not really recommended that this function is used for updating records as it would use unnecessary additional database calls. Use 'update' directly.

Parameters:
dbcon - the DBConnection object to access the database with.
sMovieID - the id for this new movie record.
sViewID - the id of the view to insert the movie record for.
sLink - the path or url for the movie.
sName - the user-friendly name for this movie.
startTime - the time at which to start this movie.
props - a list of the associated movie properties for this movie.
Returns:
Movie object.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

insertProperties

public static MovieProperties insertProperties(DBConnection dbcon,
                                               java.lang.String sMoviePropertyID,
                                               java.lang.String sMovieID,
                                               int x,
                                               int y,
                                               int width,
                                               int height,
                                               float fTransparency,
                                               long startTime)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Inserts a new movie property record in the database and returns a MovieProperty object representing this record. NOTE: If the record already exists, it returns the existing record. If an import is being run and updating was set or if it is not an import, then the record is first updated with the passed data. But it is not really recommended that this function is used for updating records as it would use unnecessary additional database calls. Use 'updateProperties' directly.

Parameters:
dbcon - the DBConnection object to access the database with.
sMoviePropertyID - the id of the movie properties record.
sMovieID - the id for the movie this is a property record for.
x - the x position of the movie in the view.
y - the y position of the movie in the view.
width - the width of the movie in the view.
height - the height of the movie in the view.
fTransparency - the transparency level of the display of the movie.
startTime - the time from which these properties apply.
Returns:
MovieProperties object.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

insert

public static Movie insert(DBConnection dbcon,
                           Movie passedMovie)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
Inserts a new movie record in the database and returns a Movie object representing this record. NOTE: If the record already exists, it returns the existing record. If an import is being run and updating was set or if it is not an import, then the record is first updated with the passed data. But it is not really recommended that this function is used for updating records as it would use unnecessary additional database calls. Use 'update' directly.

Parameters:
dbcon - the DBConnection object to access the database with.
passedMovie - the movie object to store.
Returns:
Movie object.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

insertProperties

public static MovieProperties insertProperties(DBConnection dbcon,
                                               MovieProperties passedMovie)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Inserts a new movie record in the database and returns a MovieProperties object representing this record. NOTE: If the record already exists, it returns the existing record. If an import is being run and updating was set or if it is not an import, then the record is first updated with the passed data. But it is not really recommended that this function is used for updating records as it would use unnecessary additional database calls. Use 'updateProperties' directly.

Parameters:
dbcon - the DBConnection object to access the database with.
passedMovie - the movieproperties object to store.
Returns:
MovieProperties object.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

update

public static Movie update(DBConnection dbcon,
                           java.lang.String sMovieID,
                           java.lang.String sViewID,
                           java.lang.String sLink,
                           java.lang.String sName,
                           long startTime,
                           java.util.Vector<MovieProperties> props)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
Updates a movie record with the given id in the database and returns the updated Movie object representing this record. Also update the MovieProperties in the database.

Parameters:
dbcon - the DBConnection object to access the database with.
sMovieID - the id for this new movie record.
sViewID - the id of the view to insert the movie record for.
sLink - the path or url for the movie.
sName - the user-friendly name for this movie.
startTime - the time to start this movie.
props - a list of the associated movie properties for this movie.
Returns:
updated Movie object.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

updated Movie object.

updateProperties

public static MovieProperties updateProperties(DBConnection dbcon,
                                               java.lang.String sMoviePropertyID,
                                               java.lang.String sMovieID,
                                               int x,
                                               int y,
                                               int width,
                                               int height,
                                               float fTransparency,
                                               long startTime)
                                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Updates a movieproperties record with the given id in the database and returns the updated MovieProperties object representing this record.

Parameters:
dbcon - the DBConnection object to access the database with.
sMoviePropertyID - the id for this new movieproperties record.
sMovieID - the id of the movie these are properties for
x - the x position of the movie in the view.
y - the y position of the movie in the view.
width - the width of the movie in the view.
height - the height of the movie in the view.
fTransparency - the transparency level of the display of the movie.
startTime - the time from which these properties apply.
Returns:
updated Movie object.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

                                         java.lang.String sViewID)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns the array of Movie objects in the given view.

Parameters:
dbcon - the DBConnection object to access the database with.
sViewID - the id of the View to return the Movies for.
Returns:
Vector a list of Movie objects, or an empty list.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
